thread.title: Chicago Cubs bring World Series trophy to Pat Summit Plaza
thread.title_full: Chicago Cubs bring World Series trophy to Pat Summit Plaza

title: Chicago Cubs bring World Series trophy to Pat Summit Plaza
text:
Manage Chicago Cubs bring World Series trophy to Pat Summit Plaza The Chicago Cubs Double-A affiliate, which plays in Knoxville, Tenn., took the 2016 World Series trophy to Pat Summit Plaza. Slot to 247Sports Links 
The Chicago Cubs' 2016 World Series trophy spent some time with the team's Double-A affiliate, which plays in Knoxville, Tenn., this week. 
So it was only right that the Tennessee Smokies took the trophy to the Pat Summit Plaza, named after the legendary Volunteers women's basketball coach, on the University of Tennessee campus. 
The World Series Trophy couldn't make a stop in East Tennessee w/o visiting a special lady who knows something about collecting hardware pic.twitter.com/xzx4xT3co9 â€” Tennessee Smokies (@smokiesbaseball) February 3, 2017 
Summit built a powerhouse program at Tennesse, and was a large part of increasing the relevance of women's basketball. She captured eight national titles, which trails only UConn coach Geno Auriemma (11) for the most all time in the sport. 
The former Tennessee coach stepped down in 2012 after she was diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease, and Summit passed away at the age of 64 in June 2016. 
In November, the Cubs ended a 108-year title drought by defeating the Cleveland Indians in seven games. Chicago pulled off the feat after erasing a 3-1 series deficit. 
It's the type of effort that Summit, who was known for her never-say-die attitude, would have been proud of. Author
